title: Climate Crisis
content:
US Department of Defense acknowledges future crises from climate change and the coming military and regional... <!--more--> conflicts Dr Gwynne Dyer is a world renowned military historian with a doctorate in Military and Middle Eastern History from Kings College in London and a past service record in the American, British and Canadian navies. As a scholar, he has taught War Studies at the Royal Military Academy in the UK. Dr Dyer has been a syndicated columnist for over 20 years, his writings appearing in over 175 newspapers and magazines in 45 countries.
 His earlier book “War” was the basis for a television series aired on BBC and PBS.
In 2010, Dr Dyer’s book “Climate Wars: The Fight for Survival as the World Overheats” was hailed by such people as James Lovelock , NASA’s chief scientist Dennis Bushnell, and Sr.
Crispin Tickell (former president of the Royal Geographic Society) for presenting a very viable scenario of dwindling food resources, starvation, mass migrations and a flurry of new military conflicts around the world. His Website is GwynneDyer.com
